availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Thomas Curry (Mercer County, Kentucky, clerk)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Butner Curry in Mercer County, Kentucky, on July 20,1847. Father of John Curry, George Curry, William Curry, Mollie Curry, and Robert Curry. Merchant in Harrodsburg, Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Harrodsburg in 1860. Clerk in Mercer County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 685.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 46A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mercer County, KY, June/July 1863, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film 000191859.
"William Thomas Curry (1823-1882)," Find A Grave, Memorial 55750182, accessed July 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/55750182.
